```{r title-page-plot, layout="l-page", eval=T, fig.width=15, fig.asp=0.5, warning=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
set.seed(123)  # For reproducibility

# Parameters for the Black-Scholes model
S0 <- 100      # Initial stock price
K <- 100       # Strike price
T <- 1         # Time to maturity (1 year)
r <- 0.05      # Risk-free rate
sigma <- 0.2   # Volatility
n_paths <- 12   # Number of trajectories
n_steps <- 100  # Number of time steps

# Time vector
dt <- T / n_steps
time <- seq(0, T, by = dt)

# Function to simulate Black-Scholes paths
simulate_bs_path <- function(S0, r, sigma, T, n_steps) {
  S <- numeric(n_steps + 1)
  S[1] <- S0
  for (t in 2:(n_steps + 1)) {
    Z <- rnorm(1)  # Standard normal random variable
    S[t] <- S[t - 1] * exp((r - 0.5 * sigma^2) * dt + sigma * sqrt(dt) * Z)
  }
  return(S)
}

# Simulate multiple paths
paths <- replicate(n_paths, simulate_bs_path(S0, r, sigma, T, n_steps))

# Convert to a data frame for ggplot
bs_data <- data.frame(time = rep(time, n_paths),
                      price = as.vector(paths),
                      trajectory = rep(1:n_paths, each = length(time)))

# Plot the Black-Scholes trajectories
ggplot(bs_data, aes(x = time, y = price, group = trajectory)) +
  geom_line(aes(color = as.factor(trajectory)), size = 3) +
  geom_point(size = 2, alpha = 0.5) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "none",
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA),  # No border
        panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA))  # No plot border
```
